questions.question_text: A technician replaced a failed PSU on a high-end workstation PC. Now, the PC fails to POST and does not stay turned on for more than five seconds. Which of the following power connections was most likely forgotten during installation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Explanation:

12V Power Connector:
High-end workstation PCs often have a 12V power connector (usually a 4-pin or 8-pin connector) that provides additional power to the CPU. If this connection is not made, the system may fail to POST and power off shortly after turning on.

Symptoms of Missing 12V Connection:
The fact that the PC turns on for a few seconds and then shuts down suggests that the CPU is not receiving sufficient power, which is often linked to the 12V connector being disconnected.

Selected Answer: B
B. 802.11ax

Explanation:
The 802.11ax standard, also known as Wi-Fi 6, is designed to work on both the 2.4GHz and 5GHz frequency bands, providing better performance and efficiency across both spectrums. It’s backward compatible with previous standards and supports a wide range of devices on both frequencies.

questions.question_text: Which of the following wireless networking protocols supports both 2.4GHz and 5GHz devices?
Which of the following components enables finger-based screen input for two-in-one laptops?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A digitizer is the component in a two-in-one laptop that enables finger-based or stylus input on the screen. It is responsible for converting touch inputs into digital signals that the device can interpret.
Why Digitizer?
A digitizer is integrated into the screen assembly and works to detect and process inputs such as taps, swipes, or pinches.
 

This is a standard feature in modern touchscreens, enabling functionality for both finger-based and stylus-based interactions.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: C
Explanation:
LPT1 Connection:
If the printer is listed as connected to LPT1, it suggests that the system is trying to use a parallel (LPT) port for a USB printer, which is not correct. This misconfiguration can cause the printer to appear as not working.

Next Steps:
Changing the printer's port settings to a USB port (such as USB001 or similar) in the printer properties would be the appropriate step to ensure the printer can communicate correctly with the computer.

choices.D: Swap the USB and power cables.
choices.A: Test the printer on a known-good PC.

questions.question_text: A customer reports that the default local USB printer is no longer working. The technician views the printer properties in the OS and sees the printer is connected to LPT1. Which of the following steps should the technician most likely take next?

discussion.content: Give it up for everyone who has made it this far!

comments.content: amen imma commit now.........to this test ig <:-(

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Security groups

Security groups allow you to control access to resources by assigning permissions to specific groups of users. This way, only members of the human resources department will have access to the materials.

A is correct
Security groups are used to manage access permissions to network resources, ensuring only authorized HR department members can access the shared materials.
Why Not B (Audit logs): Audit logs monitor activity but do not restrict access.

Why Not C (Time-of-day access): Time-of-day access limits when users can access resources but doesn’t specify user permissions.
Why Not D (Print server): A print server manages print jobs but does not control file access.
CompTIA A+ Exam Reference: Core 2 (220-1102), Section 2.5, access control and permissions.

questions.question_text: A human resources department uses a network shared with other departments to produce a variety of printed resources for legal retention. The human resources department only wants its members to have access to these materials. Which of the following should the technician implement?
